channel.title: XML DOM Parsing - Iterating through Nodes

item.title: XML DOM Parsing - Iterating through Nodes
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

So I was able to achieve object spawning through XML, but I am having problems iterating through the node list to spawn more than one object. The first one spawns fine, but it doesn’t loop so I don’t exactly know how to do it.

Here is my loop I currently use, feel free to point out my errors…

[code=java]
String objectId = d.getNodeValue(“ID”, nodes);
String xCoordinate = d.getNodeValue(“X”, nodes);
String yCoordinate = d.getNodeValue(“Y”, nodes);
String objectFace = d.getNodeValue(“Face”, nodes);
String objectType = d.getNodeValue(“Type”, nodes);

	    for (int i = 0; i < ((NodeList) exec).getLength(); i++) {
		    
		    int id = Integer.parseInt(objectId);
		    int x = Integer.parseInt(xCoordinate);
		    int y = Integer.parseInt(yCoordinate);
		    int face = Integer.parseInt(objectFace);
		    int type = Integer.parseInt(objectType);
	    	
		    c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(id, x, y, face, type);
	    }[/code]

Read full topic
item.source: XML DOM Parsing - Iterating through Nodes
